The expert highlights the White House: s interpretation of the economy growing at 4.1 percent in the last quarter as a vindication of its policies.
Larry Kudlow: top economic adviser to President Donald Trump, claims that even the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) numbers show that the entire $1.5 trillion tax cut is virtually paid for by higher revenues and better nominal GDP.
The CBO: s long-range forecast predicts lower revenues than it had previously projected, contradicting Kudlow's claim.
Economists: including a member of CBO's Board of Economic Advisers, could not find any evidence in CBO reports that supported Kudlow's claim.
